Lol Monero goes bulletproof now, and $DERO devs implemented it a while back.  If you like $XMR $ZEC ..do yourself a favor, and study DERO’s atlantis implementation.  PS- if dero’s lead dev doxxes himself as Nick Szabo and prove a theory of mine right, that would be tight ;)

An opportunity to contrast approaches:  Implementing more efficient txns (via Bulletproofs) cut Monero txn size 6-fold and dropped fees by 97%.  Increasing block size 6x would have made running a node more costly, decreased decentralization, and delivered less cost reduction.
